item.title: Tutorial/题解 for CodeForces 1407D
item.description: Solution First let’s consider the case where $\max(h_{i + 1}, \ldots, h_{j - 1}) < \min(h_i, h_j)$. $h_i$ could be lower or higher than $h_j$. There can be multiple $i$ that satisfies the condition and we can observe the leftmost $i$ is the first that $h_i\ge h_j$, let’s denote this $i_{min}$, other $i$ between $[i_{min},j]$ must satisfy that $h_i$ is the maximum value among $[i,j-1]$. This can be solved using monotonic stack. Assume we store the indices in the stack, when adding a new index $j$, all the indices that will be removed are a valid position to jump to
